paper_abstract: An algebraic criterion for the ergodicity of discrete random sources is presented. For finite-dimensional sources, which contain hidden Markov sources as a subclass, the criterion can be effectively computed. This result is obtained on the background of a novel, elementary theory of discrete random sources, which is based on linear spaces spanned by word functions, and linear operators; on these spaces. An outline of basic elements of this theory is provided.
paper_title: Characterization of Ergodic Hidden Markov Sources
